body_html:
You can do the following in CMD to install torchvision very quickly. However, I'd suggest that you clean your environment a little bit.

:: Detect where your python is
where python.exe
where conda.exe
:: The example output for the last two commands: (Only first line)
:: C:\Anaconda2\python.exe
:: C:\Anaconda2\Scripts\conda.exe

:: Use the pip that lives with conda
"C:\Anaconda2\Scripts\pip.exe" install torchvision

:: To clean your environment, adjust your environmental variable PATH and 
:: make sure the output (first line) of the two commands point to the same environment.
body_text:
You can do the following in CMD to install torchvision very quickly. However, I'd suggest that you clean your environment a little bit.
:: Detect where your python is
where python.exe
where conda.exe
:: The example output for the last two commands: (Only first line)
:: C:\Anaconda2\python.exe
:: C:\Anaconda2\Scripts\conda.exe

:: Use the pip that lives with conda
"C:\Anaconda2\Scripts\pip.exe" install torchvision

:: To clean your environment, adjust your environmental variable PATH and 
:: make sure the output (first line) of the two commands point to the same environment.
body:
You can do the following in CMD to install torchvision very quickly. However, I'd suggest that you clean your environment a little bit.
```cmd
:: Detect where your python is
where python.exe
where conda.exe
:: The example output for the last two commands: (Only first line)
:: C:\Anaconda2\python.exe
:: C:\Anaconda2\Scripts\conda.exe

:: Use the pip that lives with conda
"C:\Anaconda2\Scripts\pip.exe" install torchvision

:: To clean your environment, adjust your environmental variable PATH and 
:: make sure the output (first line) of the two commands point to the same environment.

```
